title: Miniaturizing and Accelerating Structure Determination by Combining Cell-Free Expression, Picoliter Deposition and Cryo-EM
content: Protein structure determination plays a fundamental role in understanding the functions and mechanisms of biological macromolecules. The three-dimensional arrangement of atoms in a protein dictates its enzymatic activity, overall stability, ligand/protein/nucleic acid binding properties and other interactions. Historically, determining protein structures has been a laborious and time-consuming process, often taking years to complete. However, in recent years, there is a demand for rapid protein structure determination due to numerous applications in fields ranging from drug development to protein engineering, the development of novel protein-based materials like biomaterials or biocatalysts, as well as fundamental research into the mechanisms underlying molecular pathways.
